Business Goal Overall Success Criteria
Provide better customer service by improving the access to the web site for viewing of schedules, purchasing and printing of tickets, and purchasing of merchandise Demonstrate that web services are available, from both on and off-site locations, with little or no disruption in services caused by equipment or link failure
Technical Requirements Success Criteria
Scalability
Configuration of a flexible IP addressing structure Adding additional subnets and server addresses does not cause routing or addressing reconfiguration
Creating a modular server farm design that can accommodate more servers without impacting the design Adding an additional server does not require reconfiguration
Availability
Using redundant links from servers to the Access Layer switches The failure of a single Access Layer switch does not affect server connectivity
Creating redundant Layer 2 switch connections at the Access Layer and using RSTP to shorten the time for redundant switched links to become active after a failure RSTP converges quickly when a link or device fails
Configuration of a fast converging routing protocol (EIGRP) at the Distribution Layer and Core Layer. EIGRP converges quickly, with little or no loss of connectivity in the event of link failure
Security
Apply filters to permit traffic to only the required ports on the servers Undesirable traffic is blocked before reaching the servers
Install firewalls and IDS capabilities at the Distribution Layer Attack signatures and known threats are stopped from reaching the servers
Manageability
Create management VLAN and provide access to the data center devices through SSH Management station is able to initiate an SSH session to devices inside the data center.
